Name: Gin Sling
Ingredients: 7.5 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0°Brix)
105 ml Thomas Henry Soda Water chilled
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Sling glass .
Prepare garnish of lemon slice wheel.
STRAIN into ice-filled glass whilst also pouring soda.
Review: Sugar balances the citrus juice, the spirit fortifies and the carbonate lengthens.
History: 'Sling' comes from the German word 'schlingen', meaning 'to swallow' and is a style of drink which was popular from the late 1800s.
Nutrition: One serving of Gin Sling contains 159 calories
